events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred on May 9th, causing front-end damage to the vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the nature of the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to manage the case and coordinate next steps.
Confirmation message sent to the customer acknowledging receipt of the auto accident claim and initiating assistance.
The insurance company requested police reports, vehicle repair estimates, and photographic evidence related to the collision.
Customer submitted all requested documents including accident photos, police report, and mechanicâ€™s damage evaluation.
Investigation team began reviewing provided documents and contacted both parties involved in the vehicle collision.
The investigation was completed successfully confirming liability and validating the extent of damage to the car.
A settlement offer based on repair estimates and liability was proposed to the policyholder for approval.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the claims process so far.
Claim approval finalized after customer agreement on the proposed settlement amount for the vehicle damage.
Insurance payment was processed and issued to the policyholder's designated account for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and confirmation of repair scheduling.
